page.title: 19RELIGION WYESHAM
page.content: A GROUP OF CHILDREN FROM WYESHAM JUNIOR SCHOOL VISITED STAUNTON CHURCH ON JUNE 26TH 1985. We arrived at the mainly{Norman Church at Staunton. At the front is an old Norman font. At the back of the Church is a fairly new English font.Near the nave are six bell ropes. The pulpit has a spiral staircase which led to a former rood screen. We tried to find {David Mushet's}tombstone but we had no luck. He invented the{Bessemer process for making steel. {SURVEY TAKEN}IN SCHOOL ON CHURCH ATTENDANCE - 13TH JUNE 1985 22 children out of 81 go to church, 7 children go to chapel, 45 go to neither. 31 go to Sunday School.
